alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Tuscaloosa and south central Fayette Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 136 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Samantha, or 14 miles southeast of Fayette, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Lurleen State Park, Samantha, Binion Creek Landing, Tierce Pattton Bridge, Lake Tuscaloosa, Moores Bridge, Echola, Highway 69 Bridge and New Lexington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
